docs.abstract: The bill was approved 65 to 32 in the Republican-led House of Delegates.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a busy day, the Supreme Court also extended the length of scheduled arguments in the challenges to the 2010 health care overhaul law.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Rules on Case Involving Miranda Rights
headline.main: New Ruling Puts Limits on Warning to Prisoners
headline.print_headline: New Ruling Puts Limits On Warning To Prisoners

docs.abstract: Supreme Court issues decision limiting the circumstances in which prisoners must be told of their rights before they are questioned; also extends the length of scheduled arguments in the challenges to the 2010 health care overhaul law, and makes public an internal ethics resolution from 1991.
docs.snippet: In a busy day, the Supreme Court also extended the length of scheduled arguments in the challenges to the 2010 health care overhaul law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress needs to devise a real fix that would be fair to doctors and make a serious effort to slow the rise of Medicare spending.
docs.abstract: Editorial calls on Congress to devise a permanent fix for the flawed formula used to calculate fees paid to doctors by Medicare and make a serious effort to slow the rise of Medicare spending; argues Congress should also take opportunity to wean doctors away from fee-for-service billing, root cause of escalating costs, into better and cheaper forms of care.
docs.snippet: Congress needs to devise a real fix that would be fair to doctors and make a serious effort to slow the rise of Medicare spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s troubles appear to be linked to the state’s shifting political landscape and a fading emotional bond to his family name.

headline.seo: Romney Faces Unexpected Challenge From Santorum in Michigan
headline.main: Romney Facing Unexpected Hurdles in Michigan
headline.print_headline: Romney Finds Unexpected Challenges as Michigan Weighs His Favorite Son Status

docs.abstract: Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney is urgently pouring resources into his home state of Michigan ahead of the state's primary; his troubles appear to be linked to the state’s shifting political landscape and a fading emotional bond to his family name; some Michigan voters say they do not believe Romney is a true conservative.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney’s troubles appear to be linked to the state’s shifting political landscape and a fading emotional bond to his family name.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our Catholic organization hasn’t strayed from our values. And we won’t, even though our commitment has put us at odds with the Obama administration.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Michael P Warsaw, president of the nonprofit EWTN Global Catholic Network, uses his organization's situation to demonstrate how the requirement that organizations provide their employees with contraceptive and sterilization procedures violates religious liberty; argues that it also imperils the financial viability of any organization that chooses not to provide such services to their employees.
docs.snippet: Our Catholic organization hasn’t strayed from our values. And we won’t, even though our commitment has put us at odds with the Obama administration.
